original_title: Sri Lanka economic governance violated over headless CoPF: Harsha
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka is violating parliamentary procedures and governance by keeping a Committee on Public Finance without a chairman since January and sending bills through it, opposition legislator Harsha de Silva said.
“No Chair for CoPF since 30 Jan 2023; bills passed in violation of standing orders,’ de Silva said in a twitter.com message.
Proceedings to appoint a chairman was postponed for the fourth time, he said.
De Silva questioned whether the governance promised to the International Monetary Fund is being delivered.
Under Sri Lanka parliament’s standing orders, the Committee on Public Finance is the only panel for which a nominee on parliament has to be appointed.
After the parliament was prorogued last year, when all committees stand dissolved, de Silva who chaired the committee was not re-appointed, despite the opposition suggesting his name.
Instead Mayantha Dissanyake was appointed by the government. He later resigned. The committee is now without a chair. (Colombo/May03/2023)
